comments.body:
nit: there is difference between `golang:1.6` and `golang:1.6.0` which I suppose we will target.
Although I think you know, `golang:1.6` will point to `golang:1.6.1` when released and so on. 
Not sure if important, but `golang:1.4` caused issues earlier
seems to me like CI should be pushing ahead until we find a problem, rather than lagging what all of our users are likely to be doing...

Ah, didn't think about it that way. Of course the CI should be on the edge.
Good point :)

I think @luxas is right - we should be using `golang:1.6.0` here. Otherwise the Go version may or may not mysteriously jump when we push a new `kubekins-test` image.

As noted, we ran into issues depending on the `golang:1.4` image in the crossbuild image, since we weren't forcing a pull from upstream. On our Jenkins this got stuck on an old 1.4.2 image, until it happened to get re-pulled one day.

It's much better to be explicit so we know when we're jumping versions.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +16,20 @@# unit and integration tests

FROM golang:1.6
MAINTAINER  Jeff Lowdermilk <jeffml@google.com>
